file_content.text: That thing I said, about the Imperials betraying us? Lieutenant Kieral doesn't need to know.
Glad you saw through the Imperials' ambush. Lieutenant Kieral will want to hear every detail.
Take down the Imps! It's us or them!
That's the room, gentlemen. Take the turrets and secure the perimeter.
All units, find an Imperial. Reinforce their positions with small arms. Move out!
This is the time. Don't let them dig in.
There's no need to escalate this.
Be calm. They aren't hostile.
Escalate? They're going to have a clear field of fire on us!
Katcho! I've just received word from Captain Biron. He's got new orders.
You'll find I'm quite ready for them, Imperial.
He said to clear out of the fortress once it's secured. It's too large for us to hold. Is something wrong?
He thought he saw another pirate. False alarm.
No, we're fine.
Uh... yes, I guess things are all fight--all right. Everything's fine.
The sergeant thought now's the time when you'd spring your nefarious trap.
He thought you'd betray us.
Hey, that's a good idea. We'd have the field of fire and everything.
Of course, if I did so, I'd go back to my outpost and the captain would have me hanged. So you're lucky as these things go.
Great.
So much for the wisdom of Sergeant Katcho.
Boy, do you look foolish.
Hey, this is not fair and you know it. He's not supposed to... to be letting fortresses go....
I'm never hearing the end of this.
Is there anything I can do?
Uh... tell your captain that he's dead-on about the fortress size. We'll be out of here as soon as all the rooms are searched.
Now!
Take out the Imperials!
"Now," what?
Sergeant Ennlicher reporting in, sir. We've received little resistance so far.
Sergeant Katcho reporting in, sir. You got here just in time for the fighting.
These here are your unit. Straight on to the audience chamber. We'll fan out to intercept reinforcements.
Carry on, Sergeants.
Acknowledged. Let's move out.
They're fanatics and they're desperate. Expect no quarter.
Be careful.
Time to show these nuts the nutcracker.
Clean house!
Right. Taking point!
Sir, now that they're gone... do you seriously expect them to be allies?
They've shown us no ill will so far.
I do, and I expect you to.
Of course they'd conceal it until the time is right.
I know Captain Biron from the old days when his unit took me prisoner. He likes the ambush, mind you.
I'm waiting for the moment when they betray us.
Not for long.
Good. Because mark my words, it's going to happen.
They've got Captain Biron leading them. I heard all about him back in the day when I was captured. Likes ambushes, he does.
Is there something I should be aware of?
Why? Do you know something?
I know two things. First is, if an Imperial wants something, you'd better not let him have it.
Second is, Captain Biron's commanding this outfit. I used to hear about him all the time, back when they had me captured.
Yeah, you're looking at a veteran here. They used to say Biron was masterful at the ambush.
You think he'll make this move soon?
When will this happen?
He wants the fortress. Once they capture it, they're going to take the turrets and turn them on us.
Meaning what?
Think about it. Where'd he learn to surround an enemy force? From hunting the Republic, that's how. And he's ready to do it again.
The safe thing to do is, as soon as the Brotherhood is broken, take down Biron's men and grab him as a prisoner.
It wouldn't take much. He's back at the base alone, and this lot will fold if we pull it on them surprise-like.
If they were enemies, I'd have noticed by now.
We don't break trust.
You think you know the mind of an Imperial better than I do? I spent three months in their cells. How about you?
You're not running this show. I am.
I'm in command here.
I know I can't countermand your orders, sir--but, if they start blasting, we're going to return fire.
I've defeated more Imperials than you've seen in your lifetime.
Don't compare yourself to me.
I'll be careful. Now be silent.
Consider me warned.
Okay, then. You just signal for us when you're ready, and we'll drop on them.
Maybe.
Don't think too long. I'm going to get ready. You just give me the signal when you need me.
Spread the word, then, and wait for my signal.
Good idea.
I see where this is going, and I don't want to hear it.
This isn't worth considering.
Uh... look, I just wanted to warn you to be careful, all right? There's not many of us left.
I'll go keep an eye on that sergeant. You take the boys here.
